author: Michael S. Derby
title: After Market Turmoil, Fed Officials Stand Firm on Rate-Increase Course
text:
Federal Reserve officials signaled the recent spasm of market volatility isn’t prompting them to rethink their path of interest-rate increases or upbeat economic outlook.
“I don’t think it’s a big story at all for central bankers,” New York Fed President William Dudley said Wednesday. “If the stock market were to go down precipitously and stay down, then that would actually feed into the economic outlook, and that would affect my view in terms of the implications for monetary policy.”
...
